Question: You recently purchased a product online, but it arrived damaged. Write a letter of complaint to the customer service department of the online store. Explain the situation and request a refund or replacement.
Answer:
Dear Customer Service,

I hope this email finds you well. I am writing to express my disappointment regarding the recent purchase I made from your online store. I ordered a laptop (Order ID: 12345) on August 15th, and upon receiving the package on August 20th, I was dismayed to find that the laptop's screen was cracked.

I must admit that I am quite surprised by this, as I have always had positive experiences with your company in the past. I have attached pictures of the damaged laptop for your reference. Given the circumstances, I kindly request either a replacement for the laptop or a full refund.

I appreciate your prompt attention to this matter and hope that it can be resolved without any further inconvenience. I have been a loyal customer of your store for several years and hope to continue our positive relationship.

Thank you for your understanding and assistance.

Sincerely,
[Your Name]

Question: You recently attended a job interview and were offered the position. Write a letter to the interviewer to express your gratitude for the opportunity and confirm your acceptance of the job offer.
Answer:
Dear [Interviewer's Name],

I hope this letter finds you well. I wanted to express my sincere gratitude for the opportunity to interview for the [Job Position] at [Company Name]. It was a pleasure meeting you and the team, and I am thrilled to have been offered the position.

I am excited about the chance to contribute to [Company Name]'s mission and work alongside such a talented group of individuals. I am confident that my skills and experiences align well with the job requirements, and I am fully committed to making a positive impact in this role.

Please consider this letter as my formal acceptance of the job offer. I am eager to start on [Start Date] and am more than ready to immerse myself in the work and the company's culture.

Once again, thank you for this wonderful opportunity. I look forward to becoming a valuable member of the team.

Best regards,
[Your Name]

Question: You borrowed your friend's camera for a special event, but unfortunately, you accidentally damaged it. Write a letter to your friend to apologize for the damage and explain what happened.
Answer:
Dear [Friend's Name],

I hope you're doing well. I want to start by saying how truly sorry I am for what happened to your camera. I borrowed it with the intention of taking great care of it, but unfortunately, an accident occurred that resulted in some damage.

During the event, I had the camera set up on a tripod, and while adjusting the angle, it slipped and fell to the ground. I immediately checked it, and I could see that the lens was cracked and the body had a few scratches. I am devastated that this happened and take full responsibility for the damage.

I understand the value of the camera to you, both sentimentally and financially, and I am willing to cover the repair costs or replace it entirely. Please let me know the best way to proceed, and I will make sure to rectify the situation as soon as possible.

Once again, I am truly sorry for this unfortunate incident and any inconvenience it may have caused you.

Sincerely,
[Your Name]
